name: AMD Platform Secure Boot
description: Platform secure boot is a processor feature that prevents the machine from running firmware images not released by the system manufacturer.
It forms a root-of-trust by fusing in cryptographic keys into the processor itself.
failure-impact: When Platform Secure boot is not set up then the chain-of-trust between the CPU and the bootloader can not be verified.
resolution: Contact your OEM, who may be able to issue a firmware update.
